name: ProShares Short Minerals
description: ProShares Short Minerals is an exchange-traded fund (ETF) that seeks to provide investment results that correspond to the inverse of the performance of the S&P Metals & Mining Select Industry Index. This fund is designed for investors who believe that the prices of metals and mining stocks will decline. By using derivatives and other instruments, SMN aims to provide a tool for hedging against falling prices in the metals and mining sector or for those looking to profit from such declines. The ETF primarily invests in companies involved in the extraction and production of metals, including precious and industrial metals, as well as those engaged in mining operations. As a leveraged inverse ETF, SMN provides twice the inverse exposure to the index, making it a more aggressive investment option compared to traditional ETFs. This fund is particularly attractive to short-term traders and experienced investors who are looking to capitalize on market volatility in the mining and metals industry. ProShares, the issuer of SMN, is known for its extensive range of ETFs that offer various investment strategies, including leveraged and inverse products. Investors should be aware of the risks associated with leveraged and inverse ETFs, including potential losses and volatility. It is essential for investors to conduct thorough research and consider their investment objectives and risk tolerance before investing in such products.
